intro: Benzingia hajekii, commonly known as the Hajek's spurge, is a flowering plant native to the United States, particularly found in the southeastern region. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as prairies and wetlands. It has simple, alternate leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are usually yellow or green. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and wetland conservation.
